meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Scotland.
meanings.sent1: In Scotland, you can use an oor to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for oors when I visited Scotland.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped an oor in the street and couldn't find it!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny oor, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the oor jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A slang term for a person's ear.
meanings.sent1: She whispered in his oor so no one else could hear.
meanings.sent2: His oor was red from the cold wind outside.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't believe his luck when he found money hidden behind his oor!
meanings.sent4: Her words went in one oor and out the other, without leaving an impression.
meanings.sent5: The earrings she wore sparkled next to her oor.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, prolonged cry of pain or distress.
meanings.sent1: The child began to oor loudly after falling off the swing.
meanings.sent2: I could hear someone ooring in the distance, and I rushed to help.
meanings.sent3: The cat started to oor when it saw the vet approaching with a needle.
meanings.sent4: The sirens made the night air oor with their piercing sound.
meanings.sent5: The actor's performance was so moving that it made the audience oor with emotion.
